subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Robert Allenby shot a four-under-par 68 yesterday to maintain a one-stroke lead at the Australian Masters in Melbourne. He had a nine-under 135 total. His fellow Australian Aaron Baddeley shot a 66 to reach eight under, and five players were four shots back, including 18-year-old Rory McIlroy of Northern Ireland. McIlroy followed his 70 with a 69.Allenby took a two-stroke lead with a birdie on the 17th, but gave the shot back on the 18th after an errant tee shot. Baddeley had eight birdies and two bogeys. He capped his round with a wedge on his final hole, the par-4 ninth, within inches for a birdie. Michael Campbell of New Zealand, the 2005 United States Open champion, failed to make the cut.
